page.title: 01IN AND AROUND DARVEL
page.content: Darvel - A small town of some 3,800 people - has a core of buildings erected during the past 150 years. Recent growth comprises mainly Local Authority Housing built during the last 50 years. Building are well maintained and incorporated amenities recorded as standard on this decade. Inhabitants have acceptable standards of civic pride and the town is neat, tidy and has an air of prosperity often absent from small industrial towns. Although increasingly used as a dormitory town. Many are still employed in the local mills weaving and machine knitting curtaining and napery.
